Snippet:
How, and to what extent, is data encrypted in transit and at rest?  Please describe encryption details and key management policy.
Fiddler encrypts our customer data in transit using SSL/TLS and at rest using AWS AES-256 encryption algorithms for all our VPCs running in our AWS cloud.
Question: How, and to what extent, is data encrypted in transit and at rest?  Please describe encryption details and key management policy.
Answer_Response: Fiddler encrypts our customer data in transit using SSL/TLS and at rest using AWS AES-256 encryption algorithms for all our VPCs running in our AWS cloud.

Snippet:
How are High Availability & Redundancy incorporated within the solution?
Fiddler uses kubernetes, container orchestration system to deploy, manage and scale our application. Our micro-services running as different pods enable us to provide high availability and redundancy, by replicating the services as needed and also K8s can bring up new pods automatically when the current pods get unhealthy.
Question: How are High Availability & Redundancy incorporated within the solution?
Answer_Response: Fiddler uses kubernetes, container orchestration system to deploy, manage and scale our application. Our micro-services running as different pods enable us to provide high availability and redundancy, by replicating the services as needed and also K8s can bring up new pods automatically when the current pods get unhealthy.

Snippet:
What type of service monitoring and alerting is implemented?  How are clients notified of error conditions, unavailability, etc?
Fiddler uses Prometheus/Grafana based infrastructure monitoring to monitor our production systems. Team has incorporated alerts based on key metrics like Pods CPU and Memory usage, application pods thresholds. When the alerts get triggered, those notify our on-call team (24/7) who handle and addresses the issues.

If the alerts are serious enough to cause any impact on system availability, then Fiddler team will inform the customer about the situation and provide regular update until the systems get restored. Team will share an update on the root cause.
Question: What type of service monitoring and alerting is implemented?  How are clients notified of error conditions, unavailability, etc?
Answer_Response:
Fiddler uses Prometheus/Grafana based infrastructure monitoring to monitor our production systems. Team has incorporated alerts based on key metrics like Pods CPU and Memory usage, application pods thresholds. When the alerts get triggered, those notify our on-call team (24/7) who handle and addresses the issues.

If the alerts are serious enough to cause any impact on system availability, then Fiddler team will inform the customer about the situation and provide regular update until the systems get restored. Team will share an update on the root cause.

Snippet:
Does the customer have any control related to applying patches, upgrades and changes to the application or infrastructure?
Yes, Customer can postpone releases if there are in the middle of the project milestone and worried about upgrades. However Fiddler team strongly recommends our customers to stay close the latest as much as possible, mainly from bug fixes and features perspectives. If Customer prefers not to be on bi-monthly STS releases, then we offer LTS (Long-Term Stable) releases that occur once every 6 months.
Question: Does the customer have any control related to applying patches, upgrades and changes to the application or infrastructure?
Answer_Response: Yes, Customer can postpone releases if there are in the middle of the project milestone and worried about upgrades. However Fiddler team strongly recommends our customers to stay close the latest as much as possible, mainly from bug fixes and features perspectives. If Customer prefers not to be on bi-monthly STS releases, then we offer LTS (Long-Term Stable) releases that occur once every 6 months.

Snippet:
What is the notification process and lead time for application and infrastructure upgrades, unavailability, etc?
Fiddler rolls out the major application release once every 2 months. We call these STS (Short-Term Stable) releases. During these roll outs, Fiddler team will give customer a few weeks in advance about the upcoming and relay any downtime if needed. Usually, these are less than an hour. For minor and patch releases, the roll outs do not affect the availability.
Reg Infra upgrades, Fiddler infra runs on AWS, any patch releases to instances and DBs performed using AWS Systems Patch manager. These upgrades happen in the background, mostly in the night, and do not affect the availability.
Question: What is the notification process and lead time for application and infrastructure upgrades, unavailability, etc?
Answer_Response:
Fiddler rolls out the major application release once every 2 months. We call these STS (Short-Term Stable) releases. During these roll outs, Fiddler team will give customer a few weeks in advance about the upcoming and relay any downtime if needed. Usually, these are less than an hour. For minor and patch releases, the roll outs do not affect the availability.
Reg Infra upgrades, Fiddler infra runs on AWS, any patch releases to instances and DBs performed using AWS Systems Patch manager. These upgrades happen in the background, mostly in the night, and do not affect the availability.

Snippet:
Describe Fiddler solution offering*
Describe product service offering?
Fiddler Model Performance Management platform has 3 core pillars: Monitoring, Explainability, and Fairness. Our mission is to deliver world-class model observability in a standard and repeatable way across the entire enterprise and as such, build trust into AI. We typically drive value in several ways including but not limited to: 1) driving a deeper understanding of model impact, 2) ensuring model’s are performing at their peak capability, and 3) allowing for faster delivery of new models to production by improving the manner in which models are validated.
Question: Describe Fiddler solution offering*
Answer_Response: Fiddler Model Performance Management platform has 3 core pillars: Monitoring, Explainability, and Fairness. Our mission is to deliver world-class model observability in a standard and repeatable way across the entire enterprise and as such, build trust into AI. We typically drive value in several ways including but not limited to: 1) driving a deeper understanding of model impact, 2) ensuring model’s are performing at their peak capability, and 3) allowing for faster delivery of new models to production by improving the manner in which models are validated.

Snippet:
Model Monitoring_019
Fiddler calculates the following model performance metrics depending on the type of task that model is performing. Accuracy is one critical performance metric that we capture for both binary classification models and multi class classification models. All of these metrics are stored on a historical basis and can be visualized on the Fiddler UI over a period of time. 
• For Binary Classification models
• Accuracy
• True Positive Rate/Recall
• False Positive Rate
• Precision
• F1 Score
• Log loss
• For Multi-class classification models -
• Accuracy
• Log loss
• For regression models -
• Coefficient of determination (R-squared)
• Mean Squared Error
• Mean Absolute Error
Further information about this can be found at : https://docs.fiddler.ai/pages/user-guide/data-science-concepts/monitoring/performance/​
Question: Model Monitoring_019
Answer_Answer:
Fiddler calculates the following model performance metrics depending on the type of task that model is performing. Accuracy is one critical performance metric that we capture for both binary classification models and multi class classification models. All of these metrics are stored on a historical basis and can be visualized on the Fiddler UI over a period of time. 
• For Binary Classification models
• Accuracy
• True Positive Rate/Recall
• False Positive Rate
• Precision
• F1 Score
• Log loss
• For Multi-class classification models -
• Accuracy
• Log loss
• For regression models -
• Coefficient of determination (R-squared)
• Mean Squared Error
• Mean Absolute Error
Further information about this can be found at : https://docs.fiddler.ai/pages/user-guide/data-science-concepts/monitoring/performance/​

Snippet:
1.       Does the platform catalogs/stores the models? How? date etc.? what are the indices, keys?
Fiddler is not a model registry
Fiddler is solely a model performance management platform that works alongside our customer's existing ML stacks in order to centralize and standardize model performance.  Fiddler is not a feature store, development platform, experiment tracker, or model registry.  However, for use cases involving model explanability Fiddler requires uploading the model artifact onto the platform.  With this, model summary descriptions, updates to model files metadata, deployment statistics,  etc. are tracked in Fiddler.
Question: 1.       Does the platform catalogs/stores the models? How? date etc.? what are the indices, keys?
Answer_SHORT ANSWER: Fiddler is not a model registry
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE: Fiddler is solely a model performance management platform that works alongside our customer's existing ML stacks in order to centralize and standardize model performance.  Fiddler is not a feature store, development platform, experiment tracker, or model registry.  However, for use cases involving model explanability Fiddler requires uploading the model artifact onto the platform.  With this, model summary descriptions, updates to model files metadata, deployment statistics,  etc. are tracked in Fiddler.

Model Monitoring_015
Fiddler can generate alerts on deviation between the training data and the production data. Fiddler ingests a training dataset and also takes in the production logs and with these two information its able to calculate drifts and other model performance metrics. Fiddler then shows these information on the UI as graphical visualizations. On any of these metrics, Fiddler can easily generate an alert to notify an Operations team when there is a deviation away from normal or crossing any thresholds.
Question: Model Monitoring_015
Answer_Answer: Fiddler can generate alerts on deviation between the training data and the production data. Fiddler ingests a training dataset and also takes in the production logs and with these two information its able to calculate drifts and other model performance metrics. Fiddler then shows these information on the UI as graphical visualizations. On any of these metrics, Fiddler can easily generate an alert to notify an Operations team when there is a deviation away from normal or crossing any thresholds.
Section Name: Deviation alerts between training & production data

Data Used for Inference_002
Fiddler detects the following three types of data integrity issues: Type violation, Range violation and missing value violations. Snippet: a) How will you respond to valid legal requests for access to Spark’s data?
Question: a) How will you respond to valid legal requests for access to Spark’s data?
Answer_Vendor Response:
For requests from government entities and agencies, Fiddler’s practice is to assess the legality of the request under applicable law and identify any available remedies to challenge the request where there are legal grounds to do so.  Unless prohibited by doing so under the legal request or applicable law, Fiddler will advise the relevant customer(s) of any such request and reasonably cooperate with the customer(s) in relation to responding to such request. To the extent that any relevant customer(s) seek a protective order relating to the request, Fiddler will reasonably cooperate with customer(s) in such defense.
 
To the extent that Fiddler receives any requests from individual users seeking to exercise rights under applicable data protection laws, Fiddler’s practice is to direct the user to submit the request to the appropriate customer(s) and to not otherwise respond to the request.

Question: Feature Input_001

Section Name: Drift, change of feature inputs used for training over time.

Snippet:
Data Used for Inference_001
Fiddler detects inference drift in your production environment and it displays the drift on its UI over a period of time. This makes it very easy for users to see when the inference drift started. You can configure Fiddler to generate an alert when the inference drift starts. Fiddler can also be used as a diagnosis tool to understand "why" the drift is happening. So not only can it let the users know "when" the inference drift starts, but it can help you understand "why" that drift is happening. You can find more details about this here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/pages/user-guide/data-science-concepts/monitoring/data-drift/​
Question: Data Used for Inference_001
Answer_Answer: Fiddler detects inference drift in your production environment and it displays the drift on its UI over a period of time. This makes it very easy for users to see when the inference drift started. You can configure Fiddler to generate an alert when the inference drift starts. Fiddler can also be used as a diagnosis tool to understand "why" the drift is happening. So not only can it let the users know "when" the inference drift starts, but it can help you understand "why" that drift is happening. You can find more details about this here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/pages/user-guide/data-science-concepts/monitoring/data-drift/​

Snippet:
Does the solution support role-based privileges?  How is this implemented and managed?
Fiddler support Role Based Access Control to control the user authorization into Fiddler. Fiddler has two types of users - Administrator and Member. It provides isolation at Org and project level. Member can only see the projects that are created by them and those projects that are shared by others. Administrator can see all the projects for a given Org. Each Project has owner, write and read. Fiddler is happy to provide more details if needed.
Question: Does the solution support role-based privileges?  How is this implemented and managed?
Answer_Response: Fiddler support Role Based Access Control to control the user authorization into Fiddler. Fiddler has two types of users - Administrator and Member. It provides isolation at Org and project level. Member can only see the projects that are created by them and those projects that are shared by others. Administrator can see all the projects for a given Org. Each Project has owner, write and read. Fiddler is happy to provide more details if needed.
Section Name: Planning & Operations - Security - Data Access, Synchronization, Isolation, Encryption, Operations & Identity Management

Snippet:
How is scalability & performance managed among different customers within the solution?  Is scalability automated or initiated through manual processes?
Fiddler provides single tenant cluster for each of our customer. The customer data is stored in RDS and S3 which are encrypted at rest and in transit. We do not share system and application resources with other customers. Fiddler will work with customer to understand the use cases, load and provision the infrastructure to meet customer needs. Since Fiddler uses K8s to deploy, manage and scale our application, we can replicate each of our application pods. If dynamic scaling is needed, Fiddler can set up ASG for the customer cluster at an additional cost.
Question: How is scalability & performance managed among different customers within the solution?  Is scalability automated or initiated through manual processes?
Answer_Response: Fiddler provides single tenant cluster for each of our customer. The customer data is stored in RDS and S3 which are encrypted at rest and in transit. We do not share system and application resources with other customers. Fiddler will work with customer to understand the use cases, load and provision the infrastructure to meet customer needs. Since Fiddler uses K8s to deploy, manage and scale our application, we can replicate each of our application pods. If dynamic scaling is needed, Fiddler can set up ASG for the customer cluster at an additional cost.
Section Name: Technology - Hosting Provider, Data Location, High Level Architecture

Secrets are passed into the application and services using the kubernetes secrets and as environment variables.

Snippet: What makes your product a compelling choice for Mayo clinic?
Question: What makes your product a compelling choice for Mayo clinic?
Answer_Vendor Response: Model Performance Management (MPM) is the foundation of model/MLOps, providing continuous visibility into your production ML, understanding why predictions are made, and enabling teams with actionable insights to refine and react to changes to improve your models. MPM is reliant not only on metrics but also on how well a model can be explained when something eventually goes wrong.

Snippet: How does your product support integration with other tools?
Question: How does your product support integration with other tools?
Answer_Vendor Response: Fiddler has an open API to make integration with other tools straightforward.  Fiddler also has a SDK to allow for custom explainers.

Snippet: What capabilites may not be present within the broader market of ML tools TODAY, but will be within the next five years?
Question: What capabilites may not be present within the broader market of ML tools TODAY, but will be within the next five years?
Answer_Vendor Response:
• Integrated Model Governance including model cards, fairness/regulatory reporting and model approval workflows
• Unified full stack model performance view from data to deployment
• Operational Autopilot to automatically correct a deployed model if an issue is encountered
• One click model performance issue detection
• Monitoring and explainability of self-tuned large language and text to image/video models

Snippet: Does your product have a unified, automated testing framework and tools for different ML models and multimodal ML apps (comprehensive for all ML components - data, api, ui, model, pipelines infrastructure etc.)
Question: Does your product have a unified, automated testing framework and tools for different ML models and multimodal ML apps (comprehensive for all ML components - data, api, ui, model, pipelines infrastructure etc.)
Answer_Vendor Response: We do support explainability and monitoring for most models (including multimodal) with a variety of continuous data integrity and drift checks, however we need to understand more details to the reasoning behind this query to provide more guidnace.

Snippet: How does your product facilitate model testing?
Question: How does your product facilitate model testing?
Answer_Vendor Response: Fiddler is a very powerful tool for model developers and model validators as well.  The monitoring, XAI, fairness and analytics aspects of the platform are equally applicable to understanding model behaviors pre-deployment.  By interrogating model training and test data, model developer and validators can use analytics and explainability to identify underperforming cohorts and feature spaces in the model.  Detailed reports and findings can be shared with other stakeholders too so that remediation steps can be discussed.

Snippet: To what extent does your product provide the ability to catch, report, and capture feedback based on ground truth (catch mistakes, near misses, and patient safety concerns)?
Question: To what extent does your product provide the ability to catch, report, and capture feedback based on ground truth (catch mistakes, near misses, and patient safety concerns)?
Answer_Vendor Response: Fiddler offers a variety of model metrics and alerting related to model drift, model performance (requires ground truth labels), data integrity, and model serving.
Answer_Additional Notes, Links, Etc:
All monitoring metrics and alerting can be found on the Fiddler documentation sites here: https://docs.fiddler.ai/docs/monitoring
https://docs.fiddler.ai/docs/alerts

Snippet: What are your products capabilities to monitor deployed models?  Are metrics customizable?
Question: What are your products capabilities to monitor deployed models?  Are metrics customizable?
Answer_Vendor Response: Fiddler offers a variety of model metrics related to model drift, model performance (requires ground truth labels), data integrity, and model serving. Custom metrics will be delivered shortly, but is a roadmap item for Q4 2022 and Q1 2023
Answer_Additional Notes, Links, Etc: All monitoring metrics can be found on the Fiddler documentation site here: https://docs.fiddler.ai/docs/monitoring

Snippet: Can your products automatically detect, update, and validate schema for the training and testing data? For example, Tensorflow provides this: https://www.tensorflow.org/tfx/data_validation/get_started
Question: Can your products automatically detect, update, and validate schema for the training and testing data? For example, Tensorflow provides this: https://www.tensorflow.org/tfx/data_validation/get_started
Answer_Vendor Response: While we have an inference mechanism for data types and we generate a schema - we still advise customers to check whether inferences to fiddler data types are fine for them or not.  We have category, integer, float, boolean, and string types.  Once a schema is given for the baseline data (training data) , either auto generated by fiddler or corrected by the user, we can detect mismatches and data integrity violations for other datasets such as production data.  We also give summary statistics about the datasets.

Snippet: To what extent does your product provide detection of data and concept drift?  How are these captured/presented to the user?
Question: To what extent does your product provide detection of data and concept drift?  How are these captured/presented to the user?
Answer_Vendor Response: Fiddler will provide real time and historical views into data drift and also the target metrics.

Snippet: To what extent does your product provide skew detection?
Question: To what extent does your product provide skew detection?
Answer_Vendor Response: Fiddler can detect differences in distributions using information theoretic distance metrics (JDS/PSI).  However, skew can mean other things in specific domains so it would help to understand the reasoning behind the query.

Snippet: How does your product incorprorate model governance?  How are ML metadata stored?  Is there a model registry?
Question: How does your product incorprorate model governance?  How are ML metadata stored?  Is there a model registry?
Answer_Vendor Response: Fiddler is solely a model performance management platform that works alongside our customer's existing ML stacks in order to centralize and standardize model performance.  Fiddler is not a feature store, development platform, experiment tracker, or model registry.  However, for use cases involving model explanability Fiddler requires uploading the model artifact onto the platform.  With this, model summary descriptions, updates to model files metadata, deployment statistics,  etc. are tracked in Fiddler.

Snippet: How does your product facilitate scalable, containerized, and fully managed app deployment capabilities including UI/UX?
Question: How does your product facilitate scalable, containerized, and fully managed app deployment capabilities including UI/UX?
Answer_Vendor Response: The entire Fiddler platform is deployed on Kubernetes, including the UI. Fiddler can be deployed in the Fiddler Cloud as a SaaS offering or on-premises in the customer's own private VPC.   The pods that drive the core services of the Fiddler platform can scale horizontally to ensure higher scale and throughput points can be met without downtime.

Snippet: How does your product reflect any dependencies a model may have on other models?
Question: How does your product reflect any dependencies a model may have on other models?
Answer_Vendor Response: NA. Fiddler does not record dependencies of a model

Snippet: Can you describe what, if any, automated labelling capabilites are present in your product?
Question: Can you describe what, if any, automated labelling capabilites are present in your product?
Answer_Vendor Response: Fiddler does not offer automated labeling capabilities.
Answer_Additional Notes, Links, Etc: Fiddler does allow for ground truth labels to be supplied in a delayed fashion and Fiddler will handle linking those label updates to the original inference.

Snippet: How does your product react to training datasets that have statistical outliers?
Question: How does your product react to training datasets that have statistical outliers?
Answer_Vendor Response: Fiddler detects data outliers and shows them as "Out of Range" violations. These are displayed on the Fiddler UI against the production data.
Answer_Additional Notes, Links, Etc: Further details can be found here: ​https://docs.fiddler.ai/pages/user-guide/data-science-concepts/monitoring/data-integrity/​

Snippet: How does your tool faciliate testing of data pipelines?
Question: How does your tool faciliate testing of data pipelines?
Answer_Vendor Response: Fiddler is a model performance management platform and will not monitor upstream pipelines, but can be used to detect and alert for data integrity issues.
Answer_Additional Notes, Links, Etc: Fiddler detects the following three types of data integrity issues: Type violation, Range violation and missing value violations. These violations are detected in real time on the production data and displayed over a time period. It helps a user easily identify when and what type of data integrity issues are happening in production. You can find more details about this here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/pages/user-guide/data-science-concepts/monitoring/data-integrity/​

Snippet: What capabilities within your product allow the extraction of model features?
Question: What capabilities within your product allow the extraction of model features?
Answer_Vendor Response: Fiddler is not a feature store.

Snippet: How is your product deployed?  Can an instance of your product be hosted within GCP?
Question: How is your product deployed?  Can an instance of your product be hosted within GCP?
Answer_Vendor Response: Yes, we support deployment in all major clouds (eg. AWS, Azure, GCP), customer VPC, and on-prem.
Answer_Additional Notes, Links, Etc: Fiddler is a Kubernetes-based application tier for processing data and calculating metrics, an analytics database for storing and processing inference logs, and a API/client for interfacing with the platform.  You can refer to more detailed information at docs.fiddler.ai

Snippet:
How is the application designed for capacity and availability?
Fiddler uses kubernetes, container orchestration system to deploy, manage and scale our application. Our micro-services running as different pods enable us to provide high availability and redundancy, by replicating the services as needed and also K8s can bring up new pods automatically when the current pods get unhealthy.
Question: How is the application designed for capacity and availability?
Answer_Response: Fiddler uses kubernetes, container orchestration system to deploy, manage and scale our application. Our micro-services running as different pods enable us to provide high availability and redundancy, by replicating the services as needed and also K8s can bring up new pods automatically when the current pods get unhealthy.

Snippet:
Please state the types of Unity or Unity customer's data (Unity data) that is stored in your service.
Although no customer data is required to be stored in Fiddler or to use Fiddler's model performance capabilities,  Fiddler generates alerts and performance monitoring on the deviation between model training data and production data.  Any customer data included in those training data sets or from production data as part of a ML model being monitored would be used in calculating these metrics.
Question: Please state the types of Unity or Unity customer's data (Unity data) that is stored in your service.
Answer_Response: Although no customer data is required to be stored in Fiddler or to use Fiddler's model performance capabilities,  Fiddler generates alerts and performance monitoring on the deviation between model training data and production data.  Any customer data included in those training data sets or from production data as part of a ML model being monitored would be used in calculating these metrics.

Snippet:
Is there a formal and approved information security program?
Yes. It includes things such as information security policies, annual risk assessment, bcp and dr plan, security and compliance roadmap, vulnerability management etc...
As part of security program we have established security committee. It's comprised of the Director of Engineering, the Senior Security Engineer, the DevOps Engineer and the Staff DevOps Engineer. Responsible for coordinating efforts to identify, analyze, and mitigate reasonably foreseeable risks to the security, confidentiality, and availability of Fiddler’s information and information systems. These responsibilities include review and approval of information security policies, user access management, vulnerability management, risk assessment, and third party and vendor management.
Question: Is there a formal and approved information security program?
Answer_Response:
Yes. It includes things such as information security policies, annual risk assessment, bcp and dr plan, security and compliance roadmap, vulnerability management etc...

Snippet:
What are the primary services your organization will provide through this partnership?
Fiddler Model Performance Management platform has 4 core pillars: Monitoring, Explainability, Model Analytics, and Fairness. Our mission is to deliver world-class model observability in a standard and repeatable way across the entire enterprise and as such, build trust into AI. We typically drive value in several ways including but not limited to: 1) driving a deeper understanding of model impact, 2) ensuring model’s are performing at their peak capability, and 3) allowing for faster delivery of new models to production by improving the manner in which models are validated.
Question: What are the primary services your organization will provide through this partnership?
Answer_Answer: Fiddler Model Performance Management platform has 4 core pillars: Monitoring, Explainability, Model Analytics, and Fairness. Our mission is to deliver world-class model observability in a standard and repeatable way across the entire enterprise and as such, build trust into AI. We typically drive value in several ways including but not limited to: 1) driving a deeper understanding of model impact, 2) ensuring model’s are performing at their peak capability, and 3) allowing for faster delivery of new models to production by improving the manner in which models are validated.

Snippet:
8. How does the model management cost compare to model building/execution cost? That is, is it 1:1 or 1/10th or any other fraction?
We don't have this data empirically. 
This ratio is certainly going to depend on the model as they vary greatly in complexity and development time. Model building and execution can include expensive hardware and complex models can drive up the training/execution cost. Model management cost really boils down to the time it takes to onboard the model to Fiddler and the cost to run the software in order to monitor the model. Fiddler focuses heavily on reducing the friction and time it takes to onboard new models, thus, we would venture to say that the cost is much less for model performance management.
Question: 8. How does the model management cost compare to model building/execution cost? That is, is it 1:1 or 1/10th or any other fraction?
Answer_SHORT ANSWER: We don't have this data empirically.
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE: This ratio is certainly going to depend on the model as they vary greatly in complexity and development time. Model building and execution can include expensive hardware and complex models can drive up the training/execution cost. Model management cost really boils down to the time it takes to onboard the model to Fiddler and the cost to run the software in order to monitor the model. Fiddler focuses heavily on reducing the friction and time it takes to onboard new models, thus, we would venture to say that the cost is much less for model performance management.

Snippet:
1.       Does the platform cater for the batch application? How?
Yes
Fiddler supports ingesting production data in both streaming and batch format. There is a specific API that allows Fiddler to take in prediction events as a batch input. You can find more information about these API here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/reference/publish_event. Fiddler can integrate with tools like Apache Airflow, Sagemaker, Snowflake etc using the APIs. More details here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/docs/airflow-integration
Question: 1.       Does the platform cater for the batch application? How?
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE: Fiddler supports ingesting production data in both streaming and batch format. There is a specific API that allows Fiddler to take in prediction events as a batch input. You can find more information about these API here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/reference/publish_event. Fiddler can integrate with tools like Apache Airflow, Sagemaker, Snowflake etc using the APIs. More details here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/docs/airflow-integration

Snippet:
2.       How does the platform adapt to the changes in the load? For example, vertical or horizontal scaling with upgrading to a more powerful compute versus adding more compute?
Yes
Fiddler application runs on Kubernetes, so accommodating scale needs can be achieved with proper planning and provisioning
1. Provision the cluster with proper resources upfront based on the customer use cases and their loads , i.e. server size, no of servers
2. Use K8s HPA to increase/decrease pods in response to the load.
We will work with customer to understand the scale requirement.
Question: 2.       How does the platform adapt to the changes in the load? For example, vertical or horizontal scaling with upgrading to a more powerful compute versus adding more compute?
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE:
Fiddler application runs on Kubernetes, so accommodating scale needs can be achieved with proper planning and provisioning
1. Provision the cluster with proper resources upfront based on the customer use cases and their loads , i.e. server size, no of servers
2. Use K8s HPA to increase/decrease pods in response to the load.
We will work with customer to understand the scale requirement.

Snippet:
1.       Does the platform support HA configurations?
Yes.
Fiddler uses kubernetes, container orchestration system to deploy, manage and scale our application. Our micro-services running as different pods enable us to provide high availability and redundancy, by replicating the services as needed and also K8s can bring up new pods automatically when the current pods get unhealthy.
Question: 1.       Does the platform support HA configurations?
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE: Fiddler uses kubernetes, container orchestration system to deploy, manage and scale our application. Our micro-services running as different pods enable us to provide high availability and redundancy, by replicating the services as needed and also K8s can bring up new pods automatically when the current pods get unhealthy.

Snippet:
1.       Please describe how the platform will meet TD security / Enterprise Protect (TRMIS) constraints in term of security:
We take security very serious. We are SOC2 type2 compliant and have several security policies including secure software development lifecycle, vulnerability management, data protection, bcp and dr. As part of vulnerability management we continuously scan and monitor our infrastructure and codebase. Some info here -- >
https://www.fiddler.ai/security
Also, we do external pentest once a year. We can share with our Vanta security and compliance dashboard which have more info in terms of controls.
Question: 1.       Please describe how the platform will meet TD security / Enterprise Protect (TRMIS) constraints in term of security:

We take security very serious. We are SOC2 type2 compliant and have several security policies including secure software development lifecycle, vulnerability management, data protection, bcp and dr. As part of vulnerability management we continuously scan and monitor our infrastructure and codebase. Some info here -- >
https://www.fiddler.ai/security
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE: Also, we do external pentest once a year. We can share with our Vanta security and compliance dashboard which have more info in terms of controls.

Snippet:
3.       How is the platform deployed across environments (e.g. Dev, Testing, Prod etc.)? Can the platform be deployed centrally/globally to service several environments?
See detailed response
This is really determined by our customer's needs.  Some of our customers choose to deploy a TEST and a PROD environment on-premises with Fiddler.  More commonly, however, customers deploy a single environment that can serve any number of model development and serving systems.  Any model they want to put under observation can be registered with Fiddler, regardless of where that model was developed, trained and served.  Conversely, most customers enjoy the simplicity of running in the Fiddler Cloud, our SaaS offering where Fiddler handles all of the infrastructure and maintenance of the environment.

17. Does your platform capture biasness? How?
Yes.
Fiddler provides the following fairness metrics:
• Disparate Impact
• Group Benefit
• Equal Opportunity
• Demographic Parity
The choice of the metric is use case-dependent. An important point to make is that it's impossible to optimize all the metrics at the same time. This is something to keep in mind when analyzing fairness metrics.

• Disparate Impact
• Group Benefit
• Equal Opportunity
• Demographic Parity
The choice of the metric is use case-dependent. An important point to make is that it's impossible to optimize all the metrics at the same time. This is something to keep in mind when analyzing fairness metrics.

Snippet:
16. Has the ML experience shaped the explainability? How?
Yes.
Fiddler came about from the need for Data Science, MLOps, and LOB teams to monitor, explain, analyze, and improve their models. In short, the need to operationalize AI/ML in a safe and trustworthy way. Fiddler goes beyond monitoring metrics to explain results. It provides a unified environment with a common language, centralized controls, and actionable insights that helps companies accelerate AI time-to-value at scale and build trust into AI. 


This is achieved through these four pillars including explainability:
Monitoring, which provides continuous visibility into performance across all deployed models from one location.
Explainability, which enables the detection and resolution of deep-rooted biases and provides granular explanations for all predictions made by models.
Analytics, which allows for efficient and contextual model performance improvements, root cause analysis, explanations of decision-making factors, and critical alerts and insights.
Fairness, which reduces model risk by detecting and mitigating bias in both training and production models.
Question: 16. Has the ML experience shaped the explainability? How?
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE:
Fiddler came about from the need for Data Science, MLOps, and LOB teams to monitor, explain, analyze, and improve their models. In short, the need to operationalize AI/ML in a safe and trustworthy way. Fiddler goes beyond monitoring metrics to explain results. It provides a unified environment with a common language, centralized controls, and actionable insights that helps companies accelerate AI time-to-value at scale and build trust into AI. 


This is achieved through these four pillars including explainability:
Monitoring, which provides continuous visibility into performance across all deployed models from one location.
Explainability, which enables the detection and resolution of deep-rooted biases and provides granular explanations for all predictions made by models.
Analytics, which allows for efficient and contextual model performance improvements, root cause analysis, explanations of decision-making factors, and critical alerts and insights.
Fairness, which reduces model risk by detecting and mitigating bias in both training and production models.

14. Are there any platform features that stand out?
Yes, Fiddler's Tabular/Text explainability, Hybrid model explainability and model analytics are industry first enterprise experiences.
Fiddler's tabular and text explainability has a patented user interface for easy understanding and counterfactuals along with high scale implementation where users can run explainability with one click - without the user supplying explanations to Fiddler. Fiddler's hybrid model explainability is an industry only solution that enables explanations of multi-modal models (text, tabular, vectors and embeddings) with recursive explanations and customizability to support user explainability. Fiddler's model analytics is an industry only query based solution to analyze and charts model behavior on regions of data.

Snippet:
12. Are there any novel ML metrics in the platform? Which ones?
Yes, "Drift Impact" and "Data Drift" for unstructured models are novel metrics.
Fiddler developed "Drift Impact" to measure the impact of the data drift of a feature in the context of its feature impact - so user can understand if the absolute drift is relevant. Fiddler also has a patent pending "Data Drift" metric for unstructured data e.g. vectors that represent text, image and embedding inputs that identify how the data has shifted, so the user can set an alert on it to be notified of a possible performance issue.
Question: 12. Are there any novel ML metrics in the platform? Which ones?

Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE: Fiddler developed "Drift Impact" to measure the impact of the data drift of a feature in the context of its feature impact - so user can understand if the absolute drift is relevant. Fiddler also has a patent pending "Data Drift" metric for unstructured data e.g. vectors that represent text, image and embedding inputs that identify how the data has shifted, so the user can set an alert on it to be notified of a possible performance issue.

Snippet:
1.       Does the platform architecture supports interactions with MLOps, model deployment in an application and model monitoring during execution? How?
Yes.  
Fiddler runs as a "sidecar" to your existing ML infrastructure.  Information about your models and the event logs themselves are published into the Fiddler platform for monitoring purposes.  If explainability of the model is also desired, Fiddler is also provided the model artifact.  During model run-time, event logs are published to Fiddler either in a streaming or batch fashion.  Latency of the publication is kept extremely low as not to negatively affect the model serving layer.
Question: 1.       Does the platform architecture supports interactions with MLOps, model deployment in an application and model monitoring during execution? How?
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE: Fiddler runs as a "sidecar" to your existing ML infrastructure.  Information about your models and the event logs themselves are published into the Fiddler platform for monitoring purposes.  If explainability of the model is also desired, Fiddler is also provided the model artifact.  During model run-time, event logs are published to Fiddler either in a streaming or batch fashion.  Latency of the publication is kept extremely low as not to negatively affect the model serving layer.

1.       What kind of reports does the platform generates?
See detailed response



Project level dashboards can be created to share findings.  Fiddler has many out-of-the-box visualizations to provide insight into model behavior.  PDP plots, confusion matrices, feature impact plots, feature correlation, feature sensitivity, data distributions, temporal plots of drift and performance metrics.  Additionally data-drift over time, and fairness metrics compared across protected attributes and their intersections.  Insights generated by Fiddler can also be extracted via API to be used in other reporting or visualization tools (eg. Tableau, Power BI).  Also, we are working to create native functionality to export pdf reports.

Tableau, Power BI).  Also, we are working to create native functionality to export pdf reports.

Snippet:
1.       Does the platform assess the quality of a model? How?
Yes.  
Prior to model deployment, model developers and model validators can use Fiddler's extensive model analytics capability to interrogate the model to find underperforming cohorts and sources of poor decisions.  Fiddler offers point-level explanations to give model validators a deeper understanding of model behaviors.  After deployment, Fiddler monitors numerous model metrics that can help stakeholders ensure the model quality remains at acceptable levels.
Question: 1.       Does the platform assess the quality of a model? How?
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE: Prior to model deployment, model developers and model validators can use Fiddler's extensive model analytics capability to interrogate the model to find underperforming cohorts and sources of poor decisions.  Fiddler offers point-level explanations to give model validators a deeper understanding of model behaviors.  After deployment, Fiddler monitors numerous model metrics that can help stakeholders ensure the model quality remains at acceptable levels.

Snippet:
7.       What level of interactivity does the visualization provide? Detail on demand?
Highly interactive.
Fiddler allows for interactive slicing and dicing of training and inference data. All visualizations and metrics can be computed for segments defined by SQL-like query predicates.  These can be arbitrarily fine-grained and applied to static datasets as well as production data time windows. This allows users to "follow their nose" through the data which allows for exploration of underperforming model cohorts and specific differences between model behaviors.  Layering on point-level explanations offers yet another form of gaining a detailed understanding of model behavior.
Question: 7.       What level of interactivity does the visualization provide? Detail on demand?
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE: Fiddler allows for interactive slicing and dicing of training and inference data. All visualizations and metrics can be computed for segments defined by SQL-like query predicates.  These can be arbitrarily fine-grained and applied to static datasets as well as production data time windows. This allows users to "follow their nose" through the data which allows for exploration of underperforming model cohorts and specific differences between model behaviors.  Layering on point-level explanations offers yet another form of gaining a detailed understanding of model behavior.

Snippet:
5.       Does the platform make inter-model comparisons on the optimized metrics of the underlying algorithms and/or their versions such as accuracy, confusion matrix, F-Score?
Yes.
Fiddler calculates the following model performance metrics depending on the type of task that model is performing. Accuracy is one critical performance metric that we capture for both binary classification models and multi class classification models. All of these metrics are stored on a historical basis and can be visualized on the Fiddler UI over a period of time. 
• For Binary Classification models
• Accuracy
• True Positive Rate/Recall
• False Positive Rate
• Precision
• F1 Score
• Log loss
• For Multi-class classification models -
• Accuracy
• Log loss
• For regression models -
• Coefficient of determination (R-squared)
• Mean Squared Error
• Mean Absolute Error
Further information about this can be found at : https://docs.fiddler.ai/pages/user-guide/data-science-concepts/monitoring/performance/​
Question: 5.       Does the platform make inter-model comparisons on the optimized metrics of the underlying algorithms and/or their versions such as accuracy, confusion matrix, F-Score?
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE:
Fiddler calculates the following model performance metrics depending on the type of task that model is performing. Accuracy is one critical performance metric that we capture for both binary classification models and multi class classification models. All of these metrics are stored on a historical basis and can be visualized on the Fiddler UI over a period of time. 
• For Binary Classification models
• Accuracy
• True Positive Rate/Recall
• False Positive Rate
• Precision
• F1 Score
• Log loss
• For Multi-class classification models -
• Accuracy
• Log loss
• For regression models -
• Coefficient of determination (R-squared)
• Mean Squared Error
• Mean Absolute Error
Further information about this can be found at : https://docs.fiddler.ai/pages/user-guide/data-science-concepts/monitoring/performance/​

4.       What kind of sanity checks does the platform run on a model?
The answer is nuanced.  Read below.
Fiddler does not interrogate the model serving layer.  All of the information required for model monitoring and explainability is pushed into the Fiddler platform.  That said, the monitoring metrics surfaced by the Fiddler platform will make it extremely clear when a model's performance has degraded or there are issues at the serving layer.

5.       How does the platform log its activity? What are the different severity levels?
Fiddler tracks all of its jobs (uploading datasets, ingesting events, registering models, etc.) in its own internal "jobs" table. 
Fiddler tracks all of its jobs (uploading datasets, ingesting events, registering models, etc.) in its own internal "jobs" table.  The UI makes the status of the jobs visible to end users so they are aware of the job statuses.  Jobs can be in a "Pending", "Success" or "Failure" state.   Monitoring alerts configured within the system can also be assigned severity levels.

Snippet:
3.       Does the platform have a notion of alerts over drifts? What are the associated thresholds?  emails, sms etc.?
Yes
Users can configure Fiddler to send alerts whenever drift metrics reach unacceptable thresholds.  In addition to drift metrics, Fiddler can send alerts based on any model metric, not just those associated with drift.  Alerts can be configured to send emails, Slack messages.  An integration with PagerDuty is also available for distributing alerts.
Question: 3.       Does the platform have a notion of alerts over drifts? What are the associated thresholds?  emails, sms etc.?
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE: Users can configure Fiddler to send alerts whenever drift metrics reach unacceptable thresholds.  In addition to drift metrics, Fiddler can send alerts based on any model metric, not just those associated with drift.  Alerts can be configured to send emails, Slack messages.  An integration with PagerDuty is also available for distributing alerts.

Snippet:
2.       Does the platform detect drifts? Data, schema and model? How?
Yes.
Fiddler calculates drift metrics for all model inputs and the model outputs.  For any model registered for monitoring, Fiddler will have the model's training dataset (or a representative baseline dataset) and the inference/event logs for that model.  Using these two datasets, Fiddler can calculate drift metrics between the baseline and the production data at any point in time and for any bin size (minute, hour, day, week, etc.).
Question: 2.       Does the platform detect drifts? Data, schema and model? How?
Answer_DETAILED RESPONSE: Fiddler calculates drift metrics for all model inputs and the model outputs.  For any model registered for monitoring, Fiddler will have the model's training dataset (or a representative baseline dataset) and the inference/event logs for that model.  Using these two datasets, Fiddler can calculate drift metrics between the baseline and the production data at any point in time and for any bin size (minute, hour, day, week, etc.).

Snippet:
Do you have defined procedures on the access provisioning, deprovisioning, and recertification processes with regard to customer data? If no, please explain why you are comfortable with not having it.
Yes
Employees that require access to customer data must have an individual account. This account, as well as actions performed with it, will be subject to additional monitoring at the discretion of the management team and subject to applicable regulations and third-party agreements. At a minimum, employees with access to customer data can expect that their actions in customer-data systems (e.g. an internal admin tool) will be logged, with the logs stored centrally for at least 30 days.
Question: Do you have defined procedures on the access provisioning, deprovisioning, and recertification processes with regard to customer data? If no, please explain why you are comfortable with not having it.
Answer_Comment: Employees that require access to customer data must have an individual account. At a minimum, employees with access to customer data can expect that their actions in customer-data systems (e.g. an internal admin tool) will be logged, with the logs stored centrally for at least 30 days.

Question: Do you have a data retention policy and does it include secure data deletion procedures? Please upload the data retention policy and describe the secure data deletion procedures. If no, please explain why you are comfortable with not having it.
Answer_Comment:
Uploading data deletion policy.
By default, a customer’s data is stored for the duration of his or her contract with Fiddler.
• Cluster will be terminated within 30 days upon contract termination.
• Customer can delete model, dataset and projects by themselves using fiddler apis.
• Any other special/selected deletion, customer will have to contact Fiddler.
Once deleted, a user’s data cannot be restored.

Snippet:
Description of application or service
ML models present complex operational challenges, and teams often lack enterprise-grade MLOps tools for model explainability or model bias assessment. As a result, too much time is spent troubleshooting, making it difficult to maintain strong performance.  Built with enterprise scale, security, and support included, Fiddler simplifies model monitoring with a unified management platform, centralized controls, and actionable insights.
Question: Description of application or service
Answer_Response: ML models present complex operational challenges, and teams often lack enterprise-grade MLOps tools for model explainability or model bias assessment. As a result, too much time is spent troubleshooting, making it difficult to maintain strong performance.  Built with enterprise scale, security, and support included, Fiddler simplifies model monitoring with a unified management platform, centralized controls, and actionable insights.

Snippet: c) Will you notify us of any such requests and in what timeframe will you notify us in?
Question: c) Will you notify us of any such requests and in what timeframe will you notify us in?
Answer_Vendor Response: Yes, unless prohibited by doing so under the legal request or applicable law, Fiddler’s practice is to advise the relevant customer(s) of any such request and reasonably cooperate with the customer(s) in relation to responding to such request. To the extent permitted to do so, Fiddler will provide notice within 30 days.

Snippet: b) Will you only release Spark’s data if you are legally compelled to? If Spark data would be released in other circumstances (other than being legally compelled to) please advise in what circumstances?
Question: b) Will you only release Spark’s data if you are legally compelled to? If Spark data would be released in other circumstances (other than being legally compelled to) please advise in what circumstances?
Answer_Vendor Response: For requests relating to legal process, as outlined above, Fiddler’s practice is to assess the legality of the request under applicable law and identify any available remedies to challenge the request where there are legal grounds to do so.  Unless prohibited by doing so under the legal request or applicable law, Fiddler will advise the relevant customer(s) of any such request and reasonably cooperate with the customer(s) in relation to responding to such request. To the extent that any relevant customer(s) seek a protective order relating to the request, Fiddler will reasonably cooperate with customer(s) in such defense.

Snippet:
government agency data requests
For requests from government entities and agencies, Fiddler’s practice is to assess the legality of the request under applicable law and identify any available remedies to challenge the request where there are legal grounds to do so.  Unless prohibited by doing so under the legal request or applicable law, Fiddler will advise the relevant customer(s) of any such request and reasonably cooperate with the customer(s) in relation to responding to such request. To the extent that any relevant customer(s) seek a protective order relating to the request, Fiddler will reasonably cooperate with customer(s) in such defense.
 
To the extent that Fiddler receives any requests from individual users seeking to exercise rights under applicable data protection laws, Fiddler’s practice is to direct the user to submit the request to the appropriate customer(s) and to not otherwise respond to the request.
Question: government agency data requests
Answer_Response:
For requests from government entities and agencies, Fiddler’s practice is to assess the legality of the request under applicable law and identify any available remedies to challenge the request where there are legal grounds to do so.  Unless prohibited by doing so under the legal request or applicable law, Fiddler will advise the relevant customer(s) of any such request and reasonably cooperate with the customer(s) in relation to responding to such request. To the extent that any relevant customer(s) seek a protective order relating to the request, Fiddler will reasonably cooperate with customer(s) in such defense.
 
To the extent that Fiddler receives any requests from individual users seeking to exercise rights under applicable data protection laws, Fiddler’s practice is to direct the user to submit the request to the appropriate customer(s) and to not otherwise respond to the request.

Snippet:
How do you differentiate from your competitors?
Fiddler's core strength is being able to bring model monitoring, explainability and fairness onto one single platform. Following are Fiddler's core differentiators:
- Ability to be alerted when a model performance issue is happening AND also do a root cause analysis on the problem by using Fiddler's analytics capability. 
- Ability to detect feature drift, model drift and model performance metrics over a period of time. 
- Out of the box dashboards that show confusion matrices, ROC charts, precision recall charts, PDP plots, feature distribution etc. 
- Ability to drill down into a segment of data in your training dataset or in your production environment, to do a slice evaluation
- Ability to do model validation using explanation techniques like SHAP, Integrated Gradients and even custom explanation techniques. Explanations could be done on structured data or text data and multi modal information. 
- Ability to get visibility into fairness metrics for the models
Question: How do you differentiate from your competitors?
Answer_Answer:
Fiddler's core strength is being able to bring model monitoring, explainability and fairness onto one single platform. Following are Fiddler's core differentiators:
- Ability to be alerted when a model performance issue is happening AND also do a root cause analysis on the problem by using Fiddler's analytics capability. 
- Ability to detect feature drift, model drift and model performance metrics over a period of time. 
- Out of the box dashboards that show confusion matrices, ROC charts, precision recall charts, PDP plots, feature distribution etc. 
- Ability to drill down into a segment of data in your training dataset or in your production environment, to do a slice evaluation
- Ability to do model validation using explanation techniques like SHAP, Integrated Gradients and even custom explanation techniques. Explanations could be done on structured data or text data and multi modal information. 
- Ability to get visibility into fairness metrics for the models

Snippet:
Submit a detailed implementation/conversion/migration plan and timeline.
The implementation plan will depend on the deployment type that Nationwide chooses. If Nationwide chooses an on-prem deployment, our Customer success team will deploy the Fiddler cluster on-prem. If Nationwide chooses our SaaS offering, that step could be bypassed as Fiddler will host the cluster. 

The next step would be onboarding models and datasets onto the Fiddler cluster. This activity will be led by our customer success team, where you will have a project manager from Fiddler manage the project. And a Solutions Consultant leading the implementation work from our side, while we have Nationwide engineers shadowing that. 

Depending on the deployment approaches that we take, we typically get customers onboarded within a 1-2 month time frame.
Question: Submit a detailed implementation/conversion/migration plan and timeline.
Answer_Answer:
The implementation plan will depend on the deployment type that Nationwide chooses. If Nationwide chooses an on-prem deployment, our Customer success team will deploy the Fiddler cluster on-prem. If Nationwide chooses our SaaS offering, that step could be bypassed as Fiddler will host the cluster. 

The next step would be onboarding models and datasets onto the Fiddler cluster. This activity will be led by our customer success team, where you will have a project manager from Fiddler manage the project. And a Solutions Consultant leading the implementation work from our side, while we have Nationwide engineers shadowing that. 

Depending on the deployment approaches that we take, we typically get customers onboarded within a 1-2 month time frame.

Snippet:
How is priority assigned to issues?
Our customer reports issues through Zendesk which will be routed to our Jira defect management system. We have weekly triage meeting to go over the issues that are not critical and get assigned priority. For Critical one, our customer success team will directly work with customers to investigate the issue and involve engineering as they see need. We have "Urgent", "High", "Normal", "Low" priority levels.
Question: How is priority assigned to issues?
Answer_Answer: Our customer reports issues through Zendesk which will be routed to our Jira defect management system. We have weekly triage meeting to go over the issues that are not critical and get assigned priority. For Critical one, our customer success team will directly work with customers to investigate the issue and involve engineering as they see need. We have "Urgent", "High", "Normal", "Low" priority levels.

Snippet:
Please provide your estimated costs associated for this effort, as mentioned in the requirements section, please try to itemize as much as possible. Please provide your Organization's pricing structure for the following Contract terms: 1 Year 3 Year 5 Year 
Fiddler's pricing structure depends on the deployment type, use cases and usage being requested. So the pricing differs whether the deployment is in our hosted cloud or in customers private cloud, whether it is used for monitoring or explainability use cases and dependent on the number of models, traffic being sent (if monitoring use case), and explanation requests being made (if explainability use case). There is no limit to the number of users. We typically work with the team to determine usage expected and then price out the contract. Pricing is more favorable for longer contract terms.
Question: Please provide your estimated costs associated for this effort, as mentioned in the requirements section, please try to itemize as much as possible. Please provide your Organization's pricing structure for the following Contract terms: 1 Year 3 Year 5 Year
Answer_Answer: Fiddler's pricing structure depends on the deployment type, use cases and usage being requested. So the pricing differs whether the deployment is in our hosted cloud or in customers private cloud, whether it is used for monitoring or explainability use cases and dependent on the number of models, traffic being sent (if monitoring use case), and explanation requests being made (if explainability use case). There is no limit to the number of users. We typically work with the team to determine usage expected and then price out the contract. Pricing is more favorable for longer contract terms.

Snippet:
What kinds of training does your company offer?
We provide two types of training:
- User training: Targeted towards a data scientist and MLOps engineer to derive value from the information that Fiddler has captured. 
- Operator and Administrator training: This is tuned towards an engineer who is responsible for operating and administering the Fiddler deployment.
Question: What kinds of training does your company offer?
Answer_Answer:
We provide two types of training:
- User training: Targeted towards a data scientist and MLOps engineer to derive value from the information that Fiddler has captured. 
- Operator and Administrator training: This is tuned towards an engineer who is responsible for operating and administering the Fiddler deployment.

What is the frequency of maintenance performed on your system?

Snippet:
On average, how long is your system unavailable while performing maintenance?
All our maintenance performed on customer production environments has zero downtime. However, there can be maintenance where the system might be unavailable for a shorter time, i.e. 30mins average.
Question: On average, how long is your system unavailable while performing maintenance?
Answer_Answer: All our maintenance performed on customer production environments has zero downtime. However, there can be maintenance where the system might be unavailable for a shorter time, i.e. 30mins average.

Snippet:
How is maintenance calculated?
system availability is calculated by subtracting the unscheduled downtime from total monthly time and dividing it by total monthly time. From our Fiddler Cloud Master Services agreement, we are contractually obligated to meet or exceed 98% uptime during each calendar month; a deliverable we are currently meeting with all of our Cloud customers.
Question: How is maintenance calculated?
Answer_Answer: system availability is calculated by subtracting the unscheduled downtime from total monthly time and dividing it by total monthly time. From our Fiddler Cloud Master Services agreement, we are contractually obligated to meet or exceed 98% uptime during each calendar month; a deliverable we are currently meeting with all of our Cloud customers.

Snippet:
How are sessions handled? (Is session randomization performed)*
The session ID is generated at random using uid-safe. It is configured to expire in the browser after 2 hours or upon explicit logout, the user's express-session is destroyed. Correct, session randomization is supported.
Question: How are sessions handled? (Is session randomization performed)*
Answer_Response: The session ID is generated at random using uid-safe. It is configured to expire in the browser after 2 hours or upon explicit logout, the user's express-session is destroyed. Correct, session randomization is supported.

Fiddler uses Vanta a 3rd party tool to monitor our infrastructure, people and computers. This tool is integrated with AWS, Bitbucket and all other vendor application that Fiddler uses and it is a continuous monitoring tool.

Answer_Answer: Model instrumentation events get fed into Fiddler in real time. For these events to show up on the UI for monitoring data, it typically takes 2-5 minutes or so.

Snippet:
Architecture_011
Fiddler provides a single tenant cluster for each of our customer. Fiddler uses K8s to deploy, manage and scale our application, and we can replicate each of our application pods. We can support dynamic scaling if needed. Depending on the customer's throughput requirements, we can provision the fiddler cluster to handle your scale out requirements.
Question: Architecture_011
Answer_Answer: Fiddler provides a single tenant cluster for each of our customer. Fiddler uses K8s to deploy, manage and scale our application, and we can replicate each of our application pods. We can support dynamic scaling if needed. Depending on the customer's throughput requirements, we can provision the fiddler cluster to handle your scale out requirements.
Section Name: Scalability: Ability to scale out -  high-throughput streaming of telemetry into system

Snippet:
Architecture_010
Fiddler support Role Based Access Control to provide finer control on who gets access to what projects within Fiddler. Fiddler has two types of users - Administrator and Member. It provides isolation at Org and project level. Member can only see the projects that are created by them and those projects that are shared by others. Administrator can see all the projects for a given Org. Each Project has owner, write and read. You can find further details here -
Question: Architecture_010
Answer_Answer: Fiddler support Role Based Access Control to provide finer control on who gets access to what projects within Fiddler. Fiddler has two types of users - Administrator and Member. It provides isolation at Org and project level. Member can only see the projects that are created by them and those projects that are shared by others. Administrator can see all the projects for a given Org. Each Project has owner, write and read. You can find further details here -
Section Name: Ability to sub-divde models in to multiple business areas.   i.e. combine RBAC with above model grouping to support limited views of models

Snippet:
Architecture_001
Fiddler provides an SDK and APIs along with it, that can be used to extract data out of Fiddler. An example of that would be extracting the explanations into another tool or dashboard via the API. You can find details about the explanation API here - https://api.fiddler.ai/#run-explanation. Other APIs can be found here - https://api.fiddler.ai​
Question: Architecture_001
Answer_Answer: Fiddler provides an SDK and APIs along with it, that can be used to extract data out of Fiddler. An example of that would be extracting the explanations into another tool or dashboard via the API. You can find details about the explanation API here - https://api.fiddler.ai/#run-explanation. Other APIs can be found here - https://api.fiddler.ai​

Snippet:
Model Governance_001
Fiddler can provide explanations at a local level for an individual record. Or at a global level. It can show the feature importance for each feature with respect to the prediction. Further details about point explainability can be found here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/explain/explanation/. Details about global explainability can be found here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/explain/global-explanation/

Fiddler also allows you to change the value of a feature input and see the effect of it on the prediction. This can be easily done via the Fiddler UI and the user can do a side-by-side comparison of the old values and the new values.
Question: Model Governance_001
Answer_Answer:
Fiddler can provide explanations at a local level for an individual record. Or at a global level. It can show the feature importance for each feature with respect to the prediction. Further details about point explainability can be found here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/explain/explanation/. Details about global explainability can be found here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/explain/global-explanation/

Fiddler also allows you to change the value of a feature input and see the effect of it on the prediction. This can be easily done via the Fiddler UI and the user can do a side-by-side comparison of the old values and the new values.
Section Name: What capabilities exist for model explainability?

Snippet:
Business Monitoring
Fiddler can inject business data and also take in metadata values. The business metric can also be plotted in a historical manner on the Fiddler UI and could be used to see correlation between the performance of the business metric and the performance of the model itself.
Question: Business Monitoring
Answer_Answer: Fiddler can inject business data and also take in metadata values. The business metric can also be plotted in a historical manner on the Fiddler UI and could be used to see correlation between the performance of the business metric and the performance of the model itself.
Section Name: Allow for definition of business level metrics on a model, and provide ability to create custom dashboards to track these and other metrics so business users have a clear view into model performance.  A simple example could be calculated sales lift based on production recommenders.

Snippet:
Model Operations_002
Fiddler tracks model drift metrics and also other metrics like accuracy, precision, recall etc. And Fiddler allows you to define alerting when any of these metrics start deviating away from normal or crosses a static threshold. These alerts could be used to trigger a model retraining.
Question: Model Operations_002
Answer_Answer: Fiddler tracks model drift metrics and also other metrics like accuracy, precision, recall etc. And Fiddler allows you to define alerting when any of these metrics start deviating away from normal or crosses a static threshold. These alerts could be used to trigger a model retraining.
Section Name: Model Retraining:  define parameters such as model drift metrics and alert when re-training required.

Snippet:
Model Operations_001
Fiddler provides a centralized monitoring dashboard that will have all of the model information, the traffic that it is taking, the alerts on the model, the drift happening on the model etc. This dashboard can be quickly sorted to show which model (out of the 1000s that you might have) has the biggest drift or highest traffic etc. And if you want to deep dive into a particular model to do some analysis, you can double click into the model and get additional details.
Question: Model Operations_001
Answer_Answer: Fiddler provides a centralized monitoring dashboard that will have all of the model information, the traffic that it is taking, the alerts on the model, the drift happening on the model etc. This dashboard can be quickly sorted to show which model (out of the 1000s that you might have) has the biggest drift or highest traffic etc. And if you want to deep dive into a particular model to do some analysis, you can double click into the model and get additional details.
Section Name: Comprehensive detailed dashboard to keep the track of models in deployment  total model request, request by period of time, model response time, model execution time,  peak load, data error rate, unique customer served.

Snippet:
Model Monitoring_023
Fiddler calculates the following model performance metrics depending on the type of task that model is performing.

• For Binary Classification models
• Accuracy
• True Positive Rate/Recall
• False Positive Rate
• Precision
• F1 Score
• Log loss
• For Multi-class classification models -
• Accuracy
• Log loss
• For regression models -
• Coefficient of determination (R-squared)
• Mean Squared Error
• Mean Absolute Error
Further information about this can be found at : https://docs.fiddler.ai/pages/user-guide/data-science-concepts/monitoring/performance/​

Fiddler also supports a rich set of APIs to integrate with the customers models. You can find information about the APIs here - https://api.fiddler.ai/#introduction​
Question: Model Monitoring_023
Answer_Answer:
Fiddler calculates the following model performance metrics depending on the type of task that model is performing.

• For Binary Classification models
• Accuracy
• True Positive Rate/Recall
• False Positive Rate
• Precision
• F1 Score
• Log loss
• For Multi-class classification models -
• Accuracy
• Log loss
• For regression models -
• Coefficient of determination (R-squared)
• Mean Squared Error
• Mean Absolute Error
Further information about this can be found at : https://docs.fiddler.ai/pages/user-guide/data-science-concepts/monitoring/performance/​

Fiddler also supports a rich set of APIs to integrate with the customers models. You can find information about the APIs here - https://api.fiddler.ai/#introduction​
Section Name: Standard, pre-defined model metrics across various types of models?  Does sensors API support this to facilitate standard approaches and reduce coding type of data scientist?

Model Monitoring_018
The inference data can be published to Fiddler via two APIs. You can stream the events via the publis_event API (https://api.fiddler.ai/#publish-event​). Fiddler also supports publishing events in a batch using the publis_events_batch API (https://api.fiddler.ai/#publish-events-batch​). You can send a sample of events or every request.
Question: Model Monitoring_018

Fiddler also supports publishing events in a batch using the publis_events_batch API (https://api.fiddler.ai/#publish-events-batch​). You can send a sample of events or every request.
Section Name: Inference supports sampling, or every request

Model Monitoring_009
A user can trigger alerts out of Fiddler by setting numerical thresholds on any model performance metric or data metric or a service health metric. You can set alerts on static thresholds with mins and maxs. You can also generate alerts on comparing the metric against a previous timeframe, whether its 1 day, 1 week or 1 month. You can find additional details about setting alerts over here - https://docs.fiddler.ai/pages/user-guide/data-science-concepts/monitoring/alerts/
